newsitem.title: JAPAN: Worst over in Japan jobless situation--govt.
newsitem.headline: Worst over in Japan jobless situation--govt.

text.p: The worst is over in Japan's employment situation, but it is hard to see an improvement anytime soon, a senior official of the government's Management and Coordination Agency told reporters on Friday.
The agency announced that the seasonally adjusted unemployment rate was 3.3 percent in January, unchanged from December.
The number of people employed in the manufacturing sector rose 0.9 percent to 14.39 million in January, the first rise since last September, he said.
"The worst was over when the jobless rate rose to 3.5 percent last year, but it is difficult to expect a quick improvement in the job situation," the official said.
The seasonally adjusted jobless rate hit a record high of 3.5 percent last May and June, but has been at either 3.4 percent or 3.3 percent since then.
"The job situation has improved since last year, but we are not sure if it will keep improving as a planned rise in the consumption tax on April 1 could have some effect on the economy," he said.
